source.title: Amplifying insert from cDNA or gDNA using Phusion PCR

source.description:
Amplify insert from cDNA or gDNA (if the fragment contains no intron) using Phusion PCR
Make TWO
reactions of the following in separate tubes:
AB
1Amount (µL)Reagent
24 µL5x Phusion Buffer
30.5 µL10 mM dNTPs
40.6 µLDMSO
51.0 µLTemplate
60.2 μlPhusion enzyme
711.0 µLdH2O
81.5 µL5 µM Forward Primer
91.5 µL5 µM Reverse Primer
1020 µLTotal

Colony PCR to check for second insert.
pFGC5941 3930 F & pFGC5941 4430 R

source.body: Vector without insert will give a band of 500bp.

source.description:
Pick two correct colonies and inoculate into
.

Check plasmid for inserts PCR to check for both inserts:
2372F/3082R or RNAi_R (insert specific)
3930F/4430R or RNAi_F (insert specific)

Use 4 primers:
2372F, 3082R, 3930F, 4430R

source.body: In the sequencing reaction, add DMSO to aid in the sequencing across the restriction enzyme digest sites (the chromatogram peaks usually drop off dramatically right after the digest sites; an alternative strategy is to PCR the final plasmid with 2372F&3082R for the left insert and 3930F&4430R for the right insert and then sequence the PCR product).

Primer sequences:
pFGC5941_2372F: CTTCATCGAAAGGACAGTAGAA
pFGC5941_3082R: CCAAACAGGCTCATAGATACT
pFGC5941_3930F: TGTACATCAGAATGTTTCTGAC
pFGC5941_4430R: CGCTCTATCATAGATGTCGCTA

source.description: Transform into agrobacterium for infiltration.

at
.
Gel purify digests and save the BamHI/XbaI digested insert for the second ligation.

for

Transform
into E. coli competent cells (homemade) and plate on Kan plates.

source.description:
PCR across the first insert using primers on the vector to check for an insert:
An empty vector will give a band of 700bp

Incubate in
shaker overnight .
The next day, do a plasmid prep (mini-prep kit) with 1 of the colonies that grew well.
